meanings.definition: Distance north or south of the equator, measured in degrees.
meanings.sent1: The ship's captain used the latitude to navigate the vast ocean.
meanings.sent2: The map displayed the latitude lines clearly, helping travelers understand their location.
meanings.sent3: The latitude of choices in the buffet left everyone satisfied.
meanings.sent4: Her latitude of opinions made her a great team player.
meanings.sent5: The latitude of possibilities in the project excited the team members.

meanings.definition: Scope for freedom of action or thought.
meanings.sent1: The students were given latitude to choose their own research topics.
meanings.sent2: The company policy allowed employees a certain latitude in decision-making.
meanings.sent3: The latitude to explore new ideas led to innovative solutions.
meanings.sent4: His latitude in creativity made him a valuable asset to the team.
meanings.sent5: The latitude to express oneself freely was appreciated by all.

meanings.definition: The angular distance of a place north or south of the earth's equator, usually expressed in degrees and minutes.
meanings.sent1: The latitude of the city was marked on the globe.
meanings.sent2: Pilots rely on latitude measurements for accurate navigation.
meanings.sent3: The latitude of the town's famous ice cream shop drew in many tourists.
meanings.sent4: The latitude of the mountain range made it a challenging climb.
meanings.sent5: The latitude of the garden's location ensured optimal sunlight for the plants.
